revised_title: Elliptic Polarization and the Action of Metals on Light
tldr: The author, David Brewster, investigates the phenomenon of elliptic polarization and the action of metals on light. He discovered that metals, such as silver and gold, can divide a polarized ray into complementary colors through successive reflections. This research led to a better understanding of how metals modify and polarize light, which has implications for various optical applications.
